8.1. In a bank, suppose that customer arrives at an exponential rate λ = 1 per minute for deposit some amount and there is only one server for amount deposition which provide service with exponential rate µ = 1.3 per minute. Simulate M/M/1 Queuing System from 11.00 am to 11.15am. i.e.simulate {X(t),t ≥ 0} where X(t) denotes number of customers in the bank at time t.
```{r}
lambda=1;mu=1.3;time=15;
inter=rexp(30,rate=lambda);
arr=cumsum(inter)
arr=arr[arr<time]
n=length(arr)
ser=rexp(n,rate=lambda)
dep=rep(0,n);
dep[1]=arr[1]+ser[1]
for(i in 2:n)
{
  dep[i]=max(arr[i],dep[i-1]+ser[i]);
}
dep=dep[dep<time]
start=sort(c(t,arr,dep))
n=length(start)
end=sort(c(t,arr,dep));
Nt=rep(0,n)
for(i in 2:n)
{
  Nt[i]=sum(arr<=start[i])-sum(dep<=start[i])
}
d1=data.frame(start,t0=rep("<=t",n),end,Nt);
d1
```
